ty!!!!

item.source: Client help getting it to connect to my server

item.title: Client help getting it to connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @Swift1 Swift`
item.description:
@Swift1 wrote:

Hmm, try this:

Open client.java and search for:

    public static final void main(String args[])

Replace this:

[code] public static final void main(String args[])
{
try
{

        anInt957 = 0;
        anInt958 = 0;
        method52(false);//highmem
        aBoolean959 = true;//members
        signlink.storeid = 32;
        signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());
        client client1 = new client();
        client1.method1(503, false, 765);
        setserver(String args[], "44735");
        return;[/code]

With this:

[code] public static final void main(String args[])
{
try
{

        anInt957 = 0;
        anInt958 = 0;
        method52(false);//highmem
        aBoolean959 = true;//members
        signlink.storeid = 32;
        signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());
        client client1 = new client();
        client1.method1(503, false, 765);
        setserver("Your server IP here", "44735");
        return;[/code]

That worked with my client, I’m not sure if it will work with yours though ;D.

Read full topic

item.title: Client help getting it to connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @Swift1 Swift`
item.description:
@Swift1 wrote:

[quote=“legendmaker, post:1, topic:242782”]ok, i have the ddsspeced open source client how do i chaneg ip withc it connect to ?

ty!!![/quote]

Did you change the IP in the client.java and EGUI.java?

If not, go to EGUI.java, it should look something like this:

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“”, “”, “”
});
}
}[/code]

Add your server’s IP to the quotations, EX:

"server.no-ip.info", "server.no-ip.info", "server.no-ip.info" }); } }

Read full topic
